column4: anyone ? how to do I output updates into a text files to view ? (System>Adminstration>Update Manager) ?
I just wanted to list them all out
use apt-get instead of update manager.. sudo apt-get upgrade
: sorry , my question is , I wanted to list all the updates and output into a text file .The list of files lib updates into a text file so I can check which one to updates
apt-get upgrade will list the available updates on the screen.
: but I wanted the list of avaliable updates print or save in a text
copy paste them to a file
whats the reason you want to view the available updates in a file?

: hope you understand my question , going to (System>Adminstration>Update Manager) , check them and will list all of the available. But I dont wanted to update it , I wanted to print all the updates output into a text file.Which let me to read them.
you mean the descriptions of each package?
: Just an output print updates via command line . The reason is simple , there are 100 hundred of updates which really trouble some to check all.
: files lib updates + description if possible
i don't know how to do what you're asking.
: oh , then nevermind, will continue asking here thanks :)
